data.name: The Microwave Problem
data.description:
# The Microwave Problem

My microwave oven at home has this functionality where you can hit a "+30" button and it will add 30 seconds to the time you want to heat your food for. This has made me incredibly lazy and even if I want to heat something for 5min, I will just spam the "+30" button 10 times instead of thinking if there are less button presses that will give me the same result!

#### What I need from you
Please write me a function that will return the shortest amount of button presses to get to the given time (As displayed on the screen).

```csharp
Kata.MicrowaveLeastMoves(string time)
``` 
```php
microwaveLeastMoves($time)
```
```c
microwave_least_moves(const char *time)
```
```python
microwave_least_moves(time)
```
```javascript
microwaveLeastMoves(time)
```

#### The rules of my Microwave are as follows:

* For this problem, you may assume that the microwave oven timer always starts at `00:00`.

* Buttons:
  - Numbers 0-9 Which when pressed, will add that number to the microwave oven timer (Starting from the left). 
      - Examples:
    
      - If I press "5" then I press "0" twice, it will put `05:00` on the timer.
    
      - If I press "3" then I press "0" it will put `00:30` on the timer
    
  - +30 which adds 30 seconds to the current timer
  - There is a "Start" button which you have to finally press before the microwave oven starts. Remember to press this!
  
* There is no need to validate input, it will always be valid.

* Input may not always be what you expect. For example you can put in `00:70` and this is valid
